publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4332 Bill Butler: Refugee Week—That the Parliament notes that 15 to 21 June is Refugee Week 2009; congratulates the Scottish Refugee Council, which has organised this important week of events, and the many communities and organisations that have worked tirelessly to deliver over 100 events across Scotland to mark the valuable contribution that asylum seekers and refugees make; deplores the human rights abuses around the world that compel people to seek sanctuary; recognises that it is our humanitarian duty to grant asylum to those fleeing persecution and that Scotland should continue to be a haven for people seeking protection; condemns those who would poison our democracy by spreading hatred, and affirms the role of the Parliament in making Scotland a place of safety where people can rebuild their lives. Supported by: Ms Wendy Alexander*
S3M-4332 Refugee Week (lodged on 9 June 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Jamie McGrigor*, David McLetchie*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Nanette Milne*, Des McNulty*, Patrick Harvie*

S3M-4332 Refugee Week (lodged on 9 June 2009) Pauline McNeill*, Elaine Smith*, Cathy Jamieson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Elaine Murray*, Gil Paterson*, Mike Pringle*, John Park*, Christina McKelvie*, Marlyn Glen*, Ken Macintosh*, Margaret Curran*, Hugh Henry*, Rob Gibson*, Sandra White*, Jackie Baillie*, Liam McArthur*, Trish Godman*, Bill Wilson*, Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Anne McLaughlin*, Robert Brown*, Jim Tolson*, Karen Whitefield*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bill Kidd*, Dave Thompson*, Lewis Macdonald*, Mary Mulligan*, Stuart McMillan*

S3M-4332 Bill Butler: Refugee Week—That the Parliament notes that 15 to 21 June is Refugee Week 2009; congratulates the Scottish Refugee Council, which has organised this important week of events, and the many communities and organisations that have worked tirelessly to deliver over 100 events across Scotland to mark the valuable contribution that asylum seekers and refugees make; deplores the human rights abuses around the world that compel people to seek sanctuary; recognises that it is our humanitarian duty to grant asylum to those fleeing persecution and that Scotland should continue to be a haven for people seeking protection; condemns those who would poison our democracy by spreading hatred, and affirms the role of the Parliament in making Scotland a place of safety where people can rebuild their lives. Supported by: Ms Wendy Alexander, Jamie Hepburn, Jamie McGrigor, David McLetchie, Malcolm Chisholm, Nanette Milne, Des McNulty, Patrick Harvie, Pauline McNeill, Elaine Smith, Cathy Jamieson, Joe FitzPatrick, Elaine Murray, Gil Paterson, Mike Pringle, John Park, Christina McKelvie, Marlyn Glen, Ken Macintosh, Margaret Curran, Hugh Henry, Rob Gibson, Sandra White, Jackie Baillie, Liam McArthur, Trish Godman, Bill Wilson, Brian Adam, Robin Harper, Hugh O’Donnell, Anne McLaughlin, Robert Brown, Jim Tolson, Karen Whitefield, Patricia Ferguson, Bill Kidd, Dave Thompson, Lewis Macdonald, Mary Mulligan, Stuart McMillan, Jack McConnell*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Margo MacDonald*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-4332 Refugee Week (lodged on 9 June 2009) Bob Doris*, Dr Richard Simpson*
S3M-4332 Refugee Week (lodged on 9 June 2009) Christopher Harvie*
S3M-4332 Refugee Week (lodged on 9 June 2009) George Foulkes*
S3M-4332 Refugee Week (lodged on 9 June 2009) Cathy Peattie*, Sarah Boyack*
